other_tests.findings: Confirmed a complete lesion of the common peroneal nerve, with loss of conduction and fibrillation potentials in sampled muscles.
Elicited a good response in the muscles of the leg; a normal compound nerve action potential was recorded.

other_tests.date: Nine months following the nerve repair
other_tests.findings: Demonstrated nascent and polyphasic units against a background of fibrillation, suggesting early reinnervation of muscle units within both divisions of the common peroneal nerve.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At fifteen months following the nerve repair, the patient demonstrated normal strength in the hamstrings against ‘full’ resistance.

other_tests.findings: No further recovery of nerve function had occurred.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The patient may require a tibialis posterior tendon transfer in the future if there is no further clinical improvement.
